RECORD:
Rare disease patients have complex clinical representations. Patients with Combined Malonic And Methylmalonic Aciduria present clinical features that include mental retardation, epilepsy, hypotonia, and ataxia. This disease is caused by a defect in the gene encoding the enzyme methylmalonyl-CoA mutase (MCM). The clinical phenotype of this disease is highly variable, with a wide range of severity.
